bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: An alumni of the University at Albany, Susan Supple joined the university administration in 1986. She served as special assistant to the president for presidential events and community relations from 2002-2006 and Special Assistant to the President from 2006 until her retirement in 2016. In this role, she acted as personal assistant to the president, oversaw strategic scheduling and planning of events and other presidential activities, acted as liaison to internal and external constituencies, and helped manage the business of the Office of the President. During her tenure she worked with presidents Kermit Hall, George Philip, and Robert Jones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Contains records of the death of President Kermit Hall, materials concerning the president's residentce, and records of seminars and events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Susan Supple.2006 February

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.
